title: Arsenal Diary : What in store this week | News
body_text:
Our men's and women's teams are both in league action this week, while the under-18s get ready for an FA Youth Cup quarter-final at Emirates Stadium.
Here's a selection of what to look out for on Arsenal.com and the official app over the next seven days.
TUESDAY
9.30am - Mikel Arteta press conference
Our manager will sit down in front of the media at Sobha Realty Training Centre for his pre-Nottingham Forest press conference.
Watch live on Arsenal.com or the official app as Mikel shares the latest team news and looks ahead to our trip to The City Ground.
WEDNESDAY
Women’s international round-up
We’ll have a bumper women’s international round-up on Wednesday, with the majority of our players who have been called up to represent their countries expected to be in action on Tuesday evening.
7.30pm - Nottingham Forest v Arsenal
We’re off to The City Ground for Wednesday’s Premier League clash with Nottingham Forest.
For all the best build-up coverage, head to Arsenal.com and the official app, where we will have our matchday show Live From N5.
Post-match interviews, highlights and a full match replay will be published after the game.
The match will be shown live on TNT Sports in the UK.
FRIDAY
Vote for February’s Players of the Month
Voting will be open to vote for our men’s and women’s Players of the Month! Who has impressed you most throughout February?
2.30pm - Renee Slegers press conference
Our head coach returns to the hot seat to take questions from the media during her pre-West Ham United press conference.
Watch it live on Arsenal.com or the official app to find out the latest team news as well as Renee’s thoughts on the Hammers.
7pm - Arsenal U18s v Manchester United
FA Youth Cup football is back at Emirates Stadium with the visit of Manchester United under-18s in the quarter-finals this Friday.
A limited number of tickets for the match will be made available, while supporters not in attendance can follow the action live on X @ArsenalAcademy or on Instagram with ‘officialarsenalacademy.’
SUNDAY
5.30pm - Arsenal Women v West Ham United
Following the end of the February international break, we return to Barclays Women’s Super League action when we host West Ham United at Mangata Pay UK Stadium on Sunday.
A win could see us close the gap on Manchester United and Chelsea at the top of the table, depending on their results earlier in the day.
Supporters in the UK who aren’t attending the game can watch it live on Sky Sports.
